posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.96 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Make privacy stick with five new official sticker packs in the Signal Artist Series: “Chug the Mouse” by Amanda Cotan, “Cozy Season” by Miguel Ángel Camprubí, “Croco’s Feelings” by Tiffany Beucher, “My Daily Life 2” by Plastic Thing, and “Rocky Talk” by Lexi Vay.

  • This update includes the next wave of design improvements for iOS 26 and iPadOS 26. Take an optimistic look at the new message bubbles floating in front of your favorite chat wallpaper in a Liquid Glass cup that’s more than half-full.

  • We also synchronized the colors of names in group chats to match other platforms, so now you’ll see the same hue for the crew as you do on Signal Desktop too.

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.95 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.96.0.1362-beta

56 new commits since 7.95.0.1351-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.96 [1]

  • Uncodegen StickerPack [2]

  • Uncodegen InstalledSticker [3]

  • Skip read cache where it’s not required [4]

  • Add support for Key Transparency self-checks [5]

  • Support opting out of using KT [6]

  • Move, instead of copy, the downloaded file to it's temp location [7] (reverted by [18])

  • Only self-check our own E164 if our phone number is discoverable [8]

  • Add first-time education sheet for Key Transparency [9]

  • Add support for Key Transparency to Backups [10]

  • Add KeyTransparencyStore, instead of static methods on KeyTransparencyManager [11]

  • Add support for KeyTransparency opt-out to Storage Service [12]

  • Update colors for group names to match other platforms [13]

  • Clear non-admin member labels if needed [14]

  • Remove two single-caller properties from ActionSheetController [15]

  • Add dismissal button to Backups-download sheet [16]

  • Quick build fix [17]

  • Revert "Move, instead of copy, the downloaded file to it's temp location" [18] (reverts [7])

  • Warn a user if their member label will show instead of bio [19]

  • Member labels in quote replies [20]

  • Blur background for incoming message bubbles. [21]

  • Debug when mix of eligible/ineligible owners found during eligibility check [22]

  • Improve UX for quoted audio reply messages [23]

  • Check for empty string after filtering [24]

  • Add MARKs to BackupSettingsStore, group methods [25]

  • preview member label should match group color [26]

  • Fix a permissions issue related to validating media tier attachments. [27]

  • member label education sheet [28]

  • trim Member labels to glyph/byte count instead of throwing [29]

  • (re)fix RTL for member labels [30]

  • Tweak appearance of incoming message bubbles in chat. [31]

  • Fix capsule labels getting cut off [32]

  • Updates to MemberLabelCoordinator PR [33]

  • Cache pin message details sql statement [34]

  • Update color for the secondary text in message bubbles. [35] (reverted by [53])

  • Document some ConversationStyle and CVCComponentMessage methods/vars. [36]

  • Use remote-config to control the pinned-thread max [37]

  • Update text styling in date headers in chat. [38]

  • Use blur background for (!) message badges in chat when there's a wallpaper. [39]

  • Allow to configure CVWallpaperBlurView as a pill. […] [40]

  • Add Toggle to HeroSheetViewController.Body [41]

  • Tweak string for Key Transparency education sheet [42]

  • Add stroke to (non-sticky) date header bubbles. [43]

  • Use CVWallpaperBlurView for typing indicator bubble in chat. [44]

  • Edit group attributes member labels final UI [45]

  • Don't fail to save member label if bio is unset [46]

  • Add new sticker packs [47]

  • Update appearance of the unread messages indicator. [48]

  • enable member label display [49]

  • Add additional backup and restore logging [50]

  • Update release notes [51]

  • Update translations [52]

  • Revert "Update color for the secondary text in message bubbles." [53] (reverts [35])

  • Increase instrumentation to improve TLS proxy debug ability [54]

  • Remove two false positive owsAssertDebug. [55]

  • Fix missing background for some system messages. [56]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.95.0.1351-beta…7.96.0.1362-beta

Take an optimistic look at the new message bubbles floating in front of your favorite chat wallpaper in a Liquid Glass cup that’s more than half-full

@Ropea , @Whatnoww could it be the fading effect in the header and footer? I tried an wallpaper image and that is the only difference I see.

Edit: I checked in an actual group and it seems the messages from others are Liquid Glass. Didnt check it on other versions though. I am not a wallpaper person, but I like the effect.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
re: bubble updates, for those who are confused by what changed, try experimenting with different wallpapers (especially custom pictures or photos that have differently-colored regions) and light/dark mode :D

also the liquid glass effect applies only to incoming (received) messages.

i’m noticing that in general, when the wallpaper is primarily dark and signal theme is set to dark (or vice versa with light), the messages look simply gorgeous :

a screenshot of two messages with reactions, in dark mode, on a dark wallpaper. the colors are really cohesive (it looks even better without the blur, because the name color is orange here)1125×521 58.2 KB

a screenshot of two messages with reactions, in light mode, on a light wallpaper. the colors are quite cohesive1125×529 61.5 KB

however, if there’s a mismatch between the visual wallpaper darkness and current theme, messages end up looking very gray (especially in light mode but also observable in dark mode):

a screenshot of two messages with reactions, in dark mode, on a light wallpaper. the colors are not as cohesive, with messages looking fairly dark-gray rather than translucent1125×519 49.7 KB

a screenshot of two messages with reactions, in light mode, on a dark wallpaper. the colors are not as cohesive, with messages looking fairly gray rather than translucent1125×527 61.5 KB

i wonder if anything can be done to improve this? maybe the messages can be more dark/bright in such cases.

(note: “dark theme dims wallpaper” is on)

additionally, i think the reaction background should also have the liquid glass effect; without it, it can look out of place (see last 2 screenshots).

little bug, noticed that on a story reaction message, after the contact’s name, there’s a {<newline>} thing now for some reason:

a screenshot of a message, showing a story reaction and reading "Reacted to [Redacted] { newline } ' s story1125×499 41.9 KB

posts.name: link ✦

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
huh, for me it doesn’t stick even from ipad. maybe because i also have a desktop and desktop.keyTransparency.beta is turned off for now

but both iphone and ipad show this sheet every time when accessing a safety number for a contact
I have 2 desktop instances so this is even stranger maybe it’s behind a feature flag and it’s gonna be enabled very very soon or something?

One of my voice messages seems to have gotten a bit borked! The audio is completely fine but the waveform shows up maxed-out and flickers when the message is played. Sometimes it’s not just the waveform; I’ve had the whole screen start flickering and going dark a couple of times too.

GIF of the waveform flickering (flashing lights warning)

I think I switched away from the chat while recording the message (which saved it as a draft)? Don’t know if that had anything to do with it!

The waveform is still broken if I save the message as an m4a and reupload it to Signal.

The voice message is personal so I can’t share it; sorry if that makes this a bit of a dead-end debugging-wise!

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.96.0/11a83db9fe86d1ca069c4da21ca8dfc21554f48407f10210235bc4a49d69a0d2.zip

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Some thoughts on the new Liquid Glass update:

  • A lot of details and clickable buttons are now based on the liquid glass elements. To me, the group/1:1 name and photo looks a bit off and not sufficiently present, floating at the top, with nothing “holding” it. Have you tried placing it on the same glass element as the buttons around? This could give the look a more consistent feeling (especially since this is a button too).

    IMG_65911170×528 84.5 KB

  • I wonder if the transparency regarding the chat bubbles could be improved. At the moment my own messages are on a solid background (unlike the other messages, maybe there should be more consistency?!). And it feels counter intuitive to have the messages, which I want to read, on a background, which makes it harder to read.
    (Maybe to make my point a bit clearer: My own message bubbles stand out (solid and lighter background) while all other (to me more important) messages blend into the background.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Especially with a dark background (which I prefer), my own messages stand out a lot (I couldn’t configure my message bubbles to be darker).

IMG_6592.PNG1170×2532 211 KB
